Name: Sphinx of Amenhotep the Second
Description: A sphinx has the body and strength of a lion and the head or face of a man, symbolizing wisdom and intelligence. The ancient Egyptians sculpted different kinds of sphinxes with a human head, a ram head, or a human face with the mane of a lion. Sphinxes represent various deities, especially Amun-Re, identified with the kings who reigned when the sphinxes were made. The human heads or faces usually have the facial features of these kings. This sphinx portrays King Amenhotep the Second.
